answers.answer: I hope you are being seen at a major medical center, university based.  Have you had a cardiac echo done, pulmonary function tests, blood gas?

had surgery, labs, cat scans of chest and abdomen repeatedly, MRI of brain, recent allergy and asthma evokation testing and have another echocardiogram friday. previous ABGs show hypoxia on room air so am on bipap and not cpap. three sleep studies a year ago and they still could not figure out on the titration test an adequate setting for my pressures. have had lung function and VQ scan in past so they could repeat them and look for changes, but doctor has not ordered this. everything done in a major university teaching hospital with computer charting, that now has decided I am too pushy about aggrressive care like IV antibiotics when I present as a diabetic with MRSA and cellulitis! I thought I was being pro-active. Once the WBC and d dimer came back, they drew blood cultures and started vancomycin, but it took 5 hours of hasseling me first.

Have you had a sniff test to see if you have a paralyzed diaphragm?  It sounds like a possibility following your surgery, and could account for alot of your problems.  Surely they have ruled that out?  Have you had MIP's and MEP's done, which are respiratory muscle special PFT's?  You sound like a medical professional, am I right?
what are mip and meps? I am an RN whose cat is helping me type. what is a sniff text? Sure am a mess when I thouhgt by now I wouldf be much better.

MIP's and MEP's are pulmonary function tests that aren't part of the usual PFT's.  They measure respiratory muscle strength.  A sniff test is a breathing test done under fluoroscopy to see if the diaphragm moves correctly.  I'm an RN also.  Maybe you need another doctor???
